item.title: Kelly add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "You are in my blood. I cant help it. We can't be anywhere except together" -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "A kiss about apple pie a la mode with the vanilla creaminess melting in the pie heat. A kiss about chocolate, when you haven't eaten chocolate in a year. A kiss about palm trees speeding by, trailing pink clouds when you drive down the Strip sizzling with champagne. A kiss about spotlights fanning the sky and the swollen sea spilling like tears all over your legs." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "Everything was chocolate ice cream and kisses and wind." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Edgar Allen Poe
item.description: "We loved with a love that was more than love." -- Edgar Allen Poe

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Gary Paulsen
item.description: "I owe everything I am and everything I will ever be to books." -- Gary Paulsen

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Joseph Joubert
item.description: "The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones." -- Joseph Joubert

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon
